Label: AC Meausrement
Comment: The Data Model intended to measure the electrical energies consumed by an electrical system which uses an Alternating Current (AC) for a three-phase (L1, L2, L3) or single-phase (L) and neutral (N). It integrates the initial version of the data Modem [THREEPHASEMEASUREMENT], extended to also perform single-phase measurements. It includes attributes for various electrical measurements such as power, frequency, current and voltage.

Label: Ability
Comment: Possession of the means or skill to do something (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Mental Ability
subClass.Comment: The mental ability of an individual to remain focused on an external stimuli or an internal experience for a certain period of time (World Health Organisation).

subClass.Label: Mobility Ability
subClass.Comment: This ability is used to represent all kinetic abilities a person may have.

subClass.Label: Sensor Ability
subClass.Comment: Sensory ability is referred to the brain's ability to receive, interpret, and effectively use the information provided by the senses in human beings such as touch, hear, smell, vision, etc.

subClass.Label: Spatial Ability
subClass.Comment: This ability expresses the capacity to understand, reason and remember the spatial relations among objects and spaces.

Label: Activity
Comment: A process that a person, group of persons, or machine does during a specific amount of time, such as visiting, shopping, etc.

subClass.Label: Emergency Activity
subClass.Comment: An activity that is done with an urgency and highest priority.

subClass.Label: Emergency Evacuation
subClass.Comment: It represents an immediate escape of people away from a particular area that has ongoing or imminent hazard to their lives or property.

subClass.Label: Navigation
subClass.Comment: The process or activity of accurately ascertaining one's position and planning and following a route (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Visit
subClass.Comment: An activity that represents an act of going to see a person or place as a guest, tourist or a spectator. Normally, this type of activity is considered as a leasiure or recreational activity.

Label: Activity Status
Comment: It expresses the status of a specific activity being performed by a person.

Label: Actuator
Comment: A device responsible for moving or controlling a mechanism or system

subClass.Label: Actuator
subClass.Comment: An actuator is a mechanical device for moving or controlling a mechanism or system. An actuator takes energy, usually created by air, electricity, or liquid, and converts that into some kind of motion.

Label: Availability Status
Comment: It expresses the status of something that is either available or not.

Label: Building
Comment: A category that includes devices as described by building related data models, such as IFC and FIEMSER

subClass.Label: Room
subClass.Comment: A room in a building. This class may be used to group devices.

subClass.Label: Tenant
subClass.Comment: A class that describes information about a tenant in a building.

Label: Building
Comment: A building represents a structure that provides shelter for its occupants or contents and stands in one place. The building is also used to provide a basic element within the spatial structure hierarchy for the components of a building project (together with site, storey, and space).

Label: Building space
Comment: An entity used to define the physical spaces of the building. A building space contains devices or building objects.

Label: Command
Comment: A directive that a device must support to perform a certain function. A command may act upon a state, but does not necessarily act upon a state. For example, the ON command acts upon the ON/OFF state, but the GET command does not act upon any state, it simply gives a directive to retrieve a certain value. We propose here a list of commands that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended.

subClass.Label: Close command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Get command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Get current meter value command
subClass.Comment: A type of get command

subClass.Label: Get meter data command
subClass.Comment: A type of get command

subClass.Label: Get meter history command
subClass.Comment: A type of get command

subClass.Label: Get sensing data command
subClass.Comment: A type of get command

subClass.Label: Notify command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Off command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: On command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Open command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Pause command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Set level command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Set relative level command
subClass.Comment: A type of set level command

subClass.Label: Start command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Step down command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Step up command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Stop command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

subClass.Label: Toggle command
subClass.Comment: A type of command

Label: Commodity
Comment: A marketable item for which there is demand, but which is supplied without qualitative differentiation across a market. SAREF refers to energy commodities such as electricity, gas, coal and oil.

subClass.Label: Coal
subClass.Comment: A type of commodity

subClass.Label: Electricity
subClass.Comment: A type of commodity

subClass.Label: Gas
subClass.Comment: A type of commodity

subClass.Label: Water
subClass.Comment: A type of commodity

Label: Description
Comment: A representation and detail of a person, object, or event. It is used to describe the details of anything.

subClass.Label: Image Description
subClass.Comment: A type of description in which images are given to provide information about any entity.

subClass.Label: Textual Description
subClass.Comment: A type of description in which only text or writings are used to provide the information about any entity.

Label: Deviation State
Comment: It models the user's deviation state from one's proposed route. For example, NoDeviate, RareDeviate, OftenDeviate, and TooOftenDeviate.

Label: Device
Comment: A thing made or adapted for a particular purpose, especially a piece of mechanical or electronic equipment (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Display Screen
subClass.Comment: A display screen is an output device to represent the information in visual or tactile form.

subClass.Label: Handheld Device
subClass.Comment: A smart device or a computer that is small enough to be used while holding it in the hands.

subClass.Label: Mobile Phone
subClass.Comment: A telephone with access to a cellular radio system so it can be used over a wide area, without a physical connection to a network (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Smartphone
subClass.Comment: A mobile phone that is able to perform many of the functions of a computer, typically having a relatively large screen and an operating system capable of running general-purpose applications (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Incident Protection Device
subClass.Comment: Device that is used to avoid and minimize the effects of potentially danger events for the occupants of the building as well as for the structure of building itself.

subClass.Label: Fire Protection Device
subClass.Comment: Device that is used to minimize the effects of potentially danger fires.

subClass.Label: Passive Fire Protection
subClass.Comment: It is an integral component installed in the building while construction to resist the fire.

subClass.Label: Fire Door
subClass.Comment: A type of door used to minimize the spread of fire and related effects by isolating two connected spaces or sections in the building.

subClass.Label: Fire Escape Ladder
subClass.Comment: A type of ladder which is used to make an emergency exit through the window out of fire accident site.

subClass.Label: Active Fire Protection Device
subClass.Comment: It is an integral part of the fire protection used as a first response to minimize the spread of fire and related effects.

subClass.Label: Fire Extinguisher
subClass.Comment: An active fire protection instrument used by persons to blow out small scale fire.

subClass.Label: Movable Device
subClass.Comment: A device that can be moved from one place to another place, e.g., mobile phone, computer trolley, etc.

subClass.Label: Handheld Device
subClass.Comment: A smart device or a computer that is small enough to be used while holding it in the hands.

subClass.Label: Mobile Phone
subClass.Comment: A telephone with access to a cellular radio system so it can be used over a wide area, without a physical connection to a network (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Smartphone
subClass.Comment: A mobile phone that is able to perform many of the functions of a computer, typically having a relatively large screen and an operating system capable of running general-purpose applications (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Sensor
subClass.Comment: Device, agent (including humans), or software (simulation) involved in, or implementing, a Procedure. Sensors respond to a stimulus, e.g., a change in the environment, or input data composed from the results of prior Observations, and generate a Result. Sensors can be hosted by Platforms.

subClass.Label: Telephone
subClass.Comment: A device for transmitting voices over a distance using wire or radio, by converting acoustic vibrations to electrical signals (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Mobile Phone
subClass.Comment: A telephone with access to a cellular radio system so it can be used over a wide area, without a physical connection to a network (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Smartphone
subClass.Comment: A mobile phone that is able to perform many of the functions of a computer, typically having a relatively large screen and an operating system capable of running general-purpose applications (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: Distance
Comment: The Distance between two points, nodes or spaces.

Label: District
Comment: District is the platform where contains multi buildings and other physical objects.

subClass.Label: Device
subClass.Comment: A building represents a structure that provides shelter for its occupants or contents and stands in one place. The building is also used to provide a basic element within the spatial structure hierarchy for the components of a building project (together with site, storey, and space).

subClass.Label: Building related
subClass.Comment: A building represents a structure that provides shelter for its occupants or contents and stands in one place. The building is also used to provide a basic element within the spatial structure hierarchy for the components of a building project (together with site, storey, and space).

subClass.Label: Actuator
subClass.Comment: A device responsible for moving or controlling a mechanism or system by performing an actuating function

subClass.Label: Switch
subClass.Comment: A device of category saref:Actuator that performs an actuating function of type saref:OnOffFunction or saref:OpenCloseFunction

subClass.Label: Door switch
subClass.Comment: A device of category saref:Actuator that consists of a switch, accomplishes the task saref:Safety, performs the saref:OpenCloseFunction, is used for controlling a door, and can be found in the state saref:OpenCloseState.

subClass.Label: Light switch
subClass.Comment: A device of category saref:Actuator that consists of a switch, accomplishes the task saref:Lighting, performs the saref:OnOffFunction, measures the property saref:Light, and can be found in the state saref:OnOffState. It can offer a switch on service.

subClass.Label: Sensor
subClass.Comment: A device that detects and responds to events or changes in the physical environment such as light, motion, or temperature changes. Further, a device of category saref:Sensor that performs a saref:SensingFunction.

subClass.Label: Smoke sensor
subClass.Comment: A device that consists of a sensor, has category saref:Sensor, performs the saref:SensingFunction and saref:EventFunction (which notifies that a certain threshold has been exceeded), and is used for the purpose of sensing a property of type saref:Smoke.

subClass.Label: Temperature sensor
subClass.Comment: A device that consists of a sensor, has category saref:Sensor, performs the saref:SensingFunction and is used for the purpose of sensing a property of type saref:Temperature

subClass.Label: Gateway
subClass.Comment: A gateway is a piece of networking hardware used in telecommunications for telecommunications networks that allows data to flow from one discrete network to another.

subClass.Label: Grid related
subClass.Comment: A category that considers devices based on energy consumption information and profiles to optimize energy efficiency.

subClass.Label: Generator
subClass.Comment: A type of energy-related device that generates energy

subClass.Label: Photovoltaic System
subClass.Comment: A power system designed to supply usable solar power by means of photovoltaics.

subClass.Label: Thermo Solar System
subClass.Comment: A power system designed to supply thermal energy by means of solar energy.

subClass.Label: Load
subClass.Comment: A type of energy-related device that consumes energy

subClass.Label: Washing machine
subClass.Comment: A device of category saref:Appliance and saref:Load that accomplishes the task saref:Washing, performs an actuating function of type saref:StartStopFunction, can be found in the state saref:StartStopState, and can have a saref:Profile that characterizes its energy consumption.

subClass.Label: Lighting device
subClass.Comment: A device used for illumination, irradiation, signaling, or projection

subClass.Label: Meter
subClass.Comment: A device built to accurately detect and display a quantity in a form readable by a human being. Further, a device of category saref:Meter that performs a saref:MeteringFunction.

subClass.Label: Energy meter
subClass.Comment: An energy meter is a device of category saref:Meter that consists of a meter, accomplishes the tasks saref:MeterReading and saref:EnergyEfficiency, performs the saref:MeteringFunction and is used for the purpose of measuring the saref:Energy property

subClass.Label: Micro renewable
subClass.Comment: A device that generates renewable energy from natural resources such as teh sun, wind and water

subClass.Label: Storage
subClass.Comment: A type of energy-related device that stores energy

Label: EntityType
Comment: Entity type describes the type of a entity like building, equipment, energy, etc.

subClass.Label: BuildingType
subClass.Comment: Building type describes the functinonal type of a building

subClass.Label: EnergyType
subClass.Comment: The energy type produced, consumed, stored or provided, such as electricity, heat and cold

subClass.Label: EquipmentType
subClass.Comment: Equipment type describes the type of an equipment

subClass.Label: PhotovoltaicType
subClass.Comment: Photovoltaic type describes the type of PV generating unit

Label: Event
Comment: The event taken place in the zone, such entertainment event, dinner, conference, etc. A non-persistent, time-based occurrence, has location, duration, and responsible actors associated with an event.

Label: Event
Comment: An occurrence; something that happens (Oxford Dictionary of English). It represents when something planned or sudden happens.

subClass.Label: Incident
subClass.Comment: An event or occurance that can be dangerous for the occupants of the building.

subClass.Label: Chemical Spill
subClass.Comment: A hazardous event that happens due to the spillage or leakge of any toxic chemical in the building.

subClass.Label: Congestion
subClass.Comment: An event that happens at bottlenecks when the flow of people increases than a provided limit due to herding (and similar phenomena of human behaviour), especially during an emergency evacuation process.

subClass.Label: Fire
subClass.Comment: An event that may burn different parts of the building and hazourdous for both the people and the building.

subClass.Label: Earthquake
subClass.Comment: A sudden violent shaking of the ground, typically causing great destruction, as a result of movements within the earth's crust or volcanic action (Oxford Dictionary of English). It may cause a sudden panic among the occupants of the building.

subClass.Label: Panic
subClass.Comment: A  sudden uncontrollable fear or anxiety among the occupants of the building that often causes wildly unthinking behaviour (Oxford Dictionary of English). In indoor environments, it may happens due to several reasons such as earthquake, fire or other sudden hazardous situations.

subClass.Label: Stampeding
subClass.Comment: A sudden and uncontrollable run by the group of people caused by panic.

subClass.Label: Terrorist Attack
subClass.Comment: A surprise event involving the deliberate use of violence against the occupants of the buildings.

subClass.Label: Sensor Event
subClass.Comment: This concept is used to express an event detected by any sensor.

Label: FeatureOfInterest
Comment: A feature is an abstraction of real world phenomena (thing, person, event, etc)

Label: Fitness Status
Comment: A fitness status is associated with a person that represent the quality of being suitable for a specific activity.

Label: Function
Comment: The functionality necessary to accomplish the task for which a Device is designed. A device can be designed to perform more than one function. Functions can be structured in categories (subclasses) that reflect different points of view, for example, considering the specific application area for which a function can be used (e.g., light, temperature, motion, heat, power, etc.), or the capability that a function can support (e.g., receive, reply, notify, etc.), and so forth.

subClass.Label: Actuating function
subClass.Comment: A function that allows to transmit data to actuators, such as level settings (e.g., temperature) or binary switching (e.g., open/close, on/off)

subClass.Label: Level control function
subClass.Comment: An actuating function that allows to do level adjustments of an actuator in a certain range (e.g., 0%-100%), such as dimming a light or set the speed of an electric motor.

subClass.Label: On off function
subClass.Comment: An actuating function that allows to switch on and off an actuator

subClass.Label: Open close function
subClass.Comment: An actuating function that allows to open and close a device

subClass.Label: Start stop function
subClass.Comment: An actuating function that allows to start and stop a device

subClass.Label: Event function
subClass.Comment: A function that allows to notify another device that a certain threshold value has been exceeded.

subClass.Label: Metering function
subClass.Comment: A function that allows to get data from a meter, such as current meter reading or instantaneous demand

subClass.Label: Sensing function
subClass.Comment: A function that allows to transmit data from sensors, such as measurement values (e.g., temperature) or sensing data (e.g., occupancy)

Label: GeographicalCoordinatesPoint
Comment: A point, typically described using a coordinate system relative to Earth, such as WGS84, includes the latitude, altitude and longitude of a place. Uniquely identified by lat/long/alt. i.e.nnspaciallyIntersects(P1, P2) :- lat(P1, LAT), long(P1, LONG), alt(P1, ALT),n  lat(P2, LAT), long(P2, LONG), alt(P2, ALT).nnsameThing(P1, P2) :- type(P1, Point), type(P2, Point), spaciallyIntersects(P1, P2).

Label: Icon
Comment: A small picture or symbol that represents a resource.

Label: Impact
Comment: An impact is a long-lasting effect of an event (or activity), that continues to exist after the event (or activity) has taken place.

Label: Intensity
Comment: The measurable amount of a property, such as force, brightness, or a magnetic field (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: KPICalculation
Comment: The KPI calculation to calculate specific KPI with mathematical model and datum source

Label: KPICalculationComponent
Comment: The component needed for KPI calculation, like mathematical model, datum source, etc.

subClass.Label: Assumption
subClass.Comment: The assumption of the methematical model of KPI calculation

subClass.Label: DatumSource
subClass.Comment: Datum source needed for KPI calculation

subClass.Label: Equation
subClass.Comment: The equation of the mathematical model for KPI calculation

subClass.Label: Mathematical_model
subClass.Comment: The mathematical model for KPI calculation. The model is composed of a set of variables and a set of equations that establish relationships between the variables.

subClass.Label: UniversalConstant
subClass.Comment: The universal constant in the mathematical model of KPI calculation

subClass.Label: Variable
subClass.Comment: The variable in the mathematical model of KPI calculation

Label: KPIEvaluatedObject
Comment: The evaluated object of key performance indicator

Label: KPIValue
Comment: KPI value is the result of KPI calculation

Label: KeyPerformanceIndicator
Comment: Key Performance Indicator that measures the progress towards stakeholder's key performance goal

subClass.Label: OperationalKPI
subClass.Comment: The operational KPI is the KPI at the operational appliance level, the KPI corresponding to zone and equipment level.

subClass.Label: StrategicKPI
subClass.Comment: The strategic KPI is the KPI at the strategic decision level, the hyper-aggregated KPI corresponding to district scale

subClass.Label: TacticalKPI
subClass.Comment: The tactical KPI is the KPI at tactical decision level, the KPI disaggregated from strategic KPI corresponding to building and system level

Label: Location
Comment: A spatial region or named place. It contains the geographical coordinates point or postal address of an object.

Label: Measurement
Comment: Represents the measured value made over a property. It is also linked to the unit of measure in which the value is expressed and the timestamp of the measurement.

subClass.Label: Power unit
subClass.Comment: The unit of measure for power

subClass.Label: Pressure unit
subClass.Comment: The unit of measure for pressure

subClass.Label: Temperature unit
subClass.Comment: The unit of measure for temperature

subClass.Label: Energy unit
subClass.Comment: The unit of measure for energy

subClass.Label: Measurement
subClass.Comment: Represents the measured value made over a property. It is also linked to the unit of measure in which the value is expressed and the timestamp of the measurement.

subClass.Label: Currency unit
subClass.Comment: The unit of measure for price

Label: Measurement
Comment: Represents the measured value made over a property. It is also linked to the unit of measure in which the value is expressed and the timestamp of the measurement.

Label: Motion State
Comment: It describes the movement of a person.

Label: Navigational State
Comment: It models the user's navigational state while following the path.

Label: Observable Property
Comment: An observable quality (property, characteristic) of a FeatureOfInterest.

Label: Observation
Comment: Act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of a property of a FeatureOfInterest. Links to a Sensor to describe what made the Observation and how; links to an ObservableProperty to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to a FeatureOfInterest to detail what that property was associated with.

Label: Observation
Comment: The observation data of the sensor or meter, the measurement of different parameternAn Observation is a Situation in which a Sensing method has been used to estimate or calculate a value of a Property of a FeatureOfInterest. Links to Sensing and Sensor describe what made the Observation and how; links to Property and Feature detail what was sensed; the result is the output of a Sensor; other metadata details times etc.

Label: ObservationProperty
Comment: The observed property describes what kind of data is observed.

subClass.Label: EnergyParameter
subClass.Comment: Energy parameter describes energy behavior in district and buildings, inluding energy production, energy storage, energy supply, energy demand, energy cost and tariff, etc.

subClass.Label: EnergyCost
subClass.Comment: The cost for purchasing energy from external grid

subClass.Label: EnergyDemand
subClass.Comment: The energy demand in district or buildings

subClass.Label: EnergyForecast
subClass.Comment: The forecast of energy demand or production

subClass.Label: EnergyGain
subClass.Comment: The energy gain is the produced energy that feed into external grid so as to obtain monetary gain

subClass.Label: EnergyProduction
subClass.Comment: Energy producted by generation system

subClass.Label: EnergyStorage
subClass.Comment: The energy stored by storage system

subClass.Label: EnergySupply
subClass.Comment: The energy supplied to end uses

subClass.Label: EnergyTariff
subClass.Comment: Tariff that is charged per energy unit by district energy providers

subClass.Label: EnvironmentalParameter
subClass.Comment: The parameter describes the environment condition, including indoor environment (indoor comfort) and outdoor environment (weather)

subClass.Label: IndoorComfort
subClass.Comment: Indoor comfort describes the indoor environment

subClass.Label: ThermalComfort
subClass.Comment: Thermal comfort describes the comfort condition related indoor temperature and humidity

subClass.Label: ThermalComfort
subClass.Comment: Thermal comfort describes the comfort condition related indoor temperature and humidity

subClass.Label: VisualComfort
subClass.Comment: The visual comfort describes the comfort related to light condition

subClass.Label: Weather
subClass.Comment: Weather describes the outdoor environment

subClass.Label: WeatherCondition
subClass.Comment: The weather condition describes the weather such as rain, sun, snow, etc.

subClass.Label: WeatherPhenomenon
subClass.Comment: Weather phenomenon describes the ourdoor temperature, humidity, solar radiation and wind.

subClass.Label: Humidity
subClass.Comment: Outdoor humidity

subClass.Label: SolarIrradiance
subClass.Comment: The intensity of outdoor solar radiation

subClass.Label: GlobalHorizontalSolar
subClass.Comment: The intensity of global solar radiation in horizontal level

subClass.Label: GlobalInclined41Solar
subClass.Comment: The intensity of global solar radiation in angel of 41 degree, the best angel in Madrid

subClass.Label: Temperature
subClass.Comment: Outdoor temperature

subClass.Label: Wind
subClass.Comment: The wind condition like wind speed and wind direction

subClass.Label: WindDirection
subClass.Comment: The weather phenomenon of wind direction

subClass.Label: WindSpeed
subClass.Comment: The weather phenomenon of wind speed

subClass.Label: WeatherForecast
subClass.Comment: The short-term forecast of the weather

subClass.Label: EquipmentParameter
subClass.Comment: The parameters of power equipment or building equipment.

subClass.Label: OccupancyParameter
subClass.Comment: The parameter of occupancy like occupant number or other property

subClass.Label: OccupantNumber
subClass.Comment: The number of occupants in the zone or building

Label: ObservationValue
Comment: The observation result of the sensor or meter

Label: OccupantBehavior
Comment: The behavior of occupant that influences to energy demand

Label: Ordered List
Comment: An ordered list with a given length an indexed items.

subClass.Label: Route
subClass.Comment: A set of connected spaces represented by a starting and ending point, that ultimately leads to some specific position or place.

subClass.Label: Exit Route
subClass.Comment: A type of route in which the ending point represents the exit of a specific space.

subClass.Label: Emergency Evacuation Route
subClass.Comment: A type of route in which only those spaces are mentioned that are potentially safe for its users as well as the ending point of it must be an exit from a particular space.

subClass.Label: Graph-Based Route
subClass.Comment: A graph-based route is a graphical way of representing a route in terms of nodes (sometimes called vertices) and edges (sometimes called arcs).

subClass.Label: Seating Arrangement Route
subClass.Comment: A type of route in which the ending point represents the seat of one or more individuals such as in cinema, stadiums, auditoriums, etc.

subClass.Label: Visit Route
subClass.Comment: A type of route created for visiting purposes within an indoor environment.

subClass.Label: Shopping Route
subClass.Comment: A type of route in which the specific points of interest are mentioned in the form of connected spaces, according to the preferences or interests of a one or more individuals.

Label: Parameter
Comment: A numerical or other measurable factor forming one of a set that defines a system or sets the conditions of its operation.

subClass.Label: Activity Impact
subClass.Comment: A parameter to express the impact of an activity on a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of any specific value or a type.

subClass.Label: Activity Severity
subClass.Comment: A parameter to express the severity of an activity for a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of  potential severity levels.

subClass.Label: Event Impact
subClass.Comment: A parameter to express the impact of an event on a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of any specific value or a type.

subClass.Label: Event Severity
subClass.Comment: A parameter to express the severity of an event for a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of  potential severity levels.

subClass.Label: Person Ability
subClass.Comment: A parameter to express the quality of an ability a specific person (or type of persons) own.

subClass.Label: Person Accessibility
subClass.Comment: A parameter to express the accessibility of any space for a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of some value.

subClass.Label: Space Saftey
subClass.Comment: A parameter to express the safety of any space for a specific person (or type of persons) in terms of some value.

subClass.Label: Travel Time
subClass.Comment: A parameter to express the time taken (in seconds) by a specific person (or type of persons) to go from one point to another point (i.e., Route Element).

Label: PerformanceGoal
Comment: The performance that needed to be achieved

Label: Physical object
Comment: Any Object that has a proper space region.  (Definition extracted from DUL ontology)

subClass.Label: Building object
subClass.Comment: An object in the building that can be controlled by devices, such as a door or a window that can be automatically opened or closed by an actuator.  (Definition taken from SAREF 1.0)

subClass.Label: Device
subClass.Comment: A tangible object designed to accomplish a particular task in households, common public buildings or offices. In order to accomplish this task, the device performs one or more functions. For example, a washing machine is designed to wash (task) and to accomplish this task it performs the start and stop function.

subClass.Label: Building device
subClass.Comment: A tangible object designed to accomplish a particular task in a building.

subClass.Label: Distribution device
subClass.Comment: Generalization of all devices that participate in a distribution system. (Definition adapated from http://www.buildingsmart-tech.org/ifc/IFC4/Add1/html/schema/ifcproductextension/lexical/ifcdistributionelement.htm)

subClass.Label: Distribution device
subClass.Comment: Generalization of all devices that participate in a distribution system. (Definition adapated from http://www.buildingsmart-tech.org/ifc/IFC4/Add1/html/schema/ifcproductextension/lexical/ifcdistributionelement.htm)

subClass.Label: Distribution control device
subClass.Comment: Represents devices of a building automation control system that are used to impart control over elements of a distribution system. (Definition adapated from http://www.buildingsmart-tech.org/ifc/IFC4/Add1/html/schema/ifcsharedbldgserviceelements/lexical/ifcdistributioncontrolelement.htm)

subClass.Label: Flow instrument
subClass.Comment:
A flow instrument reads and displays the value of a particular property of a system at a point, or displays the difference in the value of a property between two points.

Instrumentation is typically for the purpose of determining the value of the property at a point in time. It is not the purpose of an instrument to record or integrate the values over time (although they may be connected to recording devices that do perform such a function). This entity provides for all forms of mechanical flow instrument (thermometers, pressure gauges etc.) and electrical flow instruments (ammeters, voltmeters etc.)

subClass.Label: Protective device tripping unit
subClass.Comment: A protective device tripping unit breaks an electrical circuit at a separate breaking unit when a stated electric current that passes through the unit is exceeded.

subClass.Label: Sensor
subClass.Comment: A sensor is a device that measures a physical quantity and converts it into a signal which can be read by an observer or by an instrument.

subClass.Label: Unitary control element
subClass.Comment:
A unitary control element combines a number of control components into a single product, such as a thermostat or humidistat.

A unitary control element provides a housing for an aggregation of control or electrical distribution elements that, in combination, perform a singular (unitary) purpose. Each item in the aggregation may have its own geometric representation and location.

subClass.Label: DistributionFlowDevice
subClass.Comment: Represents devices of a distribution system that facilitate the distribution of energy or matter, such as air, water or power. (Definition adapated from http://www.buildingsmart-tech.org/ifc/IFC4/Add1/html/schema/ifcsharedbldgserviceelements/lexical/ifcdistributionflowelement.htm)

subClass.Label: Energy conversion device
subClass.Comment: The distribution flow element EnergyConversionDevice defines the occurrence of a device used to perform energy conversion or heat transfer and typically participates in a flow distribution system.

subClass.Label: Flow controller
subClass.Comment: The distribution flow element FlowController defines the occurrence of elements of a distribution system that are used to regulate flow through a distribution system. Examples include dampers, valves, switches, and relays.

subClass.Label: Flow moving device
subClass.Comment: The distribution flow element FlowMovingDevice defines the occurrence of an apparatus used to distribute, circulate or perform conveyance of fluids, including liquids and gases (such as a pump or fan), and typically participates in a flow distribution system.

subClass.Label: Flow storage device
subClass.Comment: The distribution flow element FlowStorageDevice defines the occurrence of a device that participates in a distribution system and is used for temporary storage (such as a tank).

subClass.Label: Flow terminal
subClass.Comment: The distribution flow element FlowTerminal defines the occurrence of a permanently attached element that acts as a terminus or beginning of a distribution system (such as an air outlet, drain, water closet, or sink). A terminal is typically a point at which a system interfaces with an external environment.

subClass.Label: Flow treatment device
subClass.Comment: The distribution flow element FlowTreatmentDevice defines the occurrence of a device typically used to remove unwanted matter from a fluid, either liquid or gas, and typically participates in a flow distribution system.

subClass.Label: Shading device
subClass.Comment: Shading devices are purpose built devices to protect from the sunlight, from natural light, or screening them from view. Shading devices can form part of the facade or can be mounted inside the building, they can be fixed or operable.

subClass.Label: Transport element
subClass.Comment: A transport element is a generalization of all transport related objects that move people, animals or goods within a building or building complex. The TransportElement defines the occurrence of a transport element.

subClass.Label: Vibration isolator
subClass.Comment: A vibration isolator is a device used to minimize the effects of vibration transmissibility in a building.

Label: PhysicalObject
Comment: An inanimate, three-dimensional object or substance. The physical object identified in the district.

subClass.Label: Building
subClass.Comment: The building in the district.

subClass.Label: BuildingThing
subClass.Comment: All things (here physical objects) that creates a building, it is intended as root of all building components.

subClass.Label: BuildingElement
subClass.Comment: The element composes the building structure.

subClass.Label: BuildingStorey
subClass.Comment: Building storey captures the storey structure in building

subClass.Label: ExteriorWall
subClass.Comment: The exterior wall that contributes thermal load to the building and zone

subClass.Label: ExteriorWindow
subClass.Comment: The exterior window that contributes thermal load to the building and zone

subClass.Label: Floor
subClass.Comment: The floor of the zone

subClass.Label: Roof
subClass.Comment: The roof of the zone

subClass.Label: Room
subClass.Comment: The room contained in the zone

subClass.Label: Zone
subClass.Comment: The thermal zone in the building

subClass.Label: BuildingEquipment
subClass.Comment: The equipment contained in building

subClass.Label: Duct
subClass.Comment: The duct in HVAC system

subClass.Label: Fan
subClass.Comment: The fan in HVAC system

subClass.Label: Pipe
subClass.Comment: The pipe in HVAC system, DHW system, etc.

subClass.Label: Pump
subClass.Comment: The pump in HVAC system, DHW system, etc.

subClass.Label: Shade
subClass.Comment: The shade of building envelope

subClass.Label: EnergyFacility
subClass.Comment: The energy facility in building that consumes or produces energy

subClass.Label: Equipment
subClass.Comment: The equipment in building and district power system.

subClass.Label: PowerEquipment
subClass.Comment: Power equipment is the equipment contained in district power system.

subClass.Label: Non-renewableGeneratingUnit
subClass.Comment: The generating unit produces energy with non-renewable resources.

subClass.Label: RenewableGeneratingUnit
subClass.Comment: The generating unit produces energy with renewable resources.

subClass.Label: PhotovoltaicGeneratingUnit
subClass.Comment: The generating unit produces energy with solar energy, photovoltaic panels.

subClass.Label: WindGeneratingUnit
subClass.Comment: The generating unit produces energy with wind energy, wind turbines.

subClass.Label: StoringUnit
subClass.Comment: Storing unit is the device that stores energy.

subClass.Label: Battery
subClass.Comment: The set of batteries that stores energy.

subClass.Label: ElectricVehicle
subClass.Comment: Electric vehicle that stores energy.

subClass.Label: Occupant
subClass.Comment: The occupant who occupies the zone in building

Label: Profile
Comment: A specification associated to a device to collect information about a certain Property (e.g., Energy) or Commodity (e.g.Water) for optimizing its usage in the home, office or building in which the device is located. This specification is about a certain Property or Commodity (saref:isAbout), can be calculated over a time span (saref:hasTime ) and can be associated to some costs (saref:hasPrice). An example is the Power Profile defined in the SAREF4ENER extension that can be associated to a device for optimizing the Energy efficiency in the home, office or building in which the device is located.

Label: Property
Comment: An aspect of an entity that can be observable by a sensor.

subClass.Label: CO2 level
subClass.Comment: A property related to measurements of CO2 level in the air. Measured in ppm.

subClass.Label: Current
subClass.Comment: A property related to measurements measured in Ampere (A).

subClass.Label: Flow
subClass.Comment: A property related to measurements of rates of flow, measured in m³/s. This may for instance be used to measure air flow in ventilation or water flow in district heating systems.

subClass.Label: State of charge
subClass.Comment: A property related to measurements of the battery status of a device. Measured in %. 100 % means fully charged. 0 % no charge.

subClass.Label: Voltage
subClass.Comment: Voltage in Volts

subClass.Label: Volume
subClass.Comment: A property related to measurements measured in volume. Volume is measured in m³.

subClass.Label: AC Frequency
subClass.Comment: AC frequency is the number of cycles per second in an alternating current (AC) sine wave.

subClass.Label: Alarm
subClass.Comment: A warning of danger or potential undesired situation.

subClass.Label: Current
subClass.Comment: The movement of electricity in a particular direction.

subClass.Label: Day Type
subClass.Comment: Represents the type of weather for a given location (e.g. sunny, cloudy,...).

subClass.Label: Gas Consumption
subClass.Comment: The amount of gas consumed.

subClass.Label: Heat Consumption
subClass.Comment: The amount of heat consumed.

subClass.Label: Network Link Strength
subClass.Comment: The strength of a network link

subClass.Label: Occupancy
subClass.Comment: Usage of a space.

subClass.Label: On Off
subClass.Comment: A property that determines if something is activated (on) or not (off).

subClass.Label: Power Consumption
subClass.Comment: The amount of power consumed.

subClass.Label: Power Supply
subClass.Comment: Power supplied to a load.

subClass.Label: RSSI
subClass.Comment: Received Signal Strength Indicator

subClass.Label: Temperature Setpoint
subClass.Comment: The target value at which a controller attempts to maintain the temperature.

subClass.Label: VOC
subClass.Comment: A property that determines the Volatile Organic Compounds (VOC).

subClass.Label: Voltage
subClass.Comment: The force of an electric current, measured in volts.

subClass.Label: Water Consumption
subClass.Comment: The amount of water consumed.

subClass.Label: Humidity
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a humidity unit

subClass.Label: Light
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a illuminance unit (lux)

subClass.Label: Motion
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a unit of measure for motion

subClass.Label: Occupancy
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value (saref:hasValue property) that is measured in a unit of measure for occupancy

subClass.Label: Power
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a power unit (such as watt or kilowatt).  Further specializations of the saref:Power class can be found in the SAREF4ENER extension, where classes such as PowerMax, PowerMin and PowerExpected are defined.

subClass.Label: Pressure
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a pressure unit (bar or pascal)

subClass.Label: Price
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property crelated to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured using saref:Currency

subClass.Label: Smoke
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a unit of measure for smoke

subClass.Label: Temperature
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a temperature unit (degree_Celsius, degree_Fahrenheit, or degree_kelvin)

subClass.Label: Time
subClass.Comment: A saref:Property that allows to specify the time concept in terms of instants or intervals according to the imported W3C Time ontology.

Label: Property
Comment: Anything that can be sensed, measured or controlled in households, common public buildings or offices. We propose here a list of properties that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended.

Label: Quality
Comment: A degree or grade of excellence or worth.

Label: Role
Comment: The function assumed or part played by a person or thing in a particular situation (Oxford Dictionary of English).

Label: Role In Context
Comment: A concept to express that an agent is playing a role in a given context.

Label: Route Element
Comment: It represents the physical or conceptual elements of a navigation path.

subClass.Label: Passage
subClass.Comment: Any spatial element that is part of a path and traversable by persons. In addition, it may be used as a logic representation of physical passages to represent an edge (or an arc) in a route graph.

subClass.Label: Horizontal Passage
subClass.Comment: A type of a passage that connects spatial elements located on the same storey or floor.

subClass.Label: Point Of Interest Segement
subClass.Comment: A traverasal part of a space that is connected to a specific Point of Interest.

subClass.Label: Road
subClass.Comment: A road is a way on land between two places that has been paved or otherwise improved to allow travel by foot or some form of conveyance, including a motor vehicle, cart, bicycle, or horse.

subClass.Label: Room Segment
subClass.Comment: A traversable part in a room that is usually used to go the exit or the other part of the room.

subClass.Label: Vertical Passage
subClass.Comment: A type of passage that connects spatial elements located on different storey or floor.

subClass.Label: Route Point
subClass.Comment: Any spatial element that is part of a path and traversable by persons. In addition, it may be used as a logic representation of physical passages to represent a node (or a vertex) in a route graph.

subClass.Label: Transition Point
subClass.Comment: A point at which person passes from one place to the next.

subClass.Label: Waiting Zone
subClass.Comment: A space (normally with seating), where people can wait to do some specific activity. During emergency condtions, it is also used for several purposes, such as unification of people with their family members, acquaintances or emergency rescue teams, etc.

Label: Schedule
Comment: The day schedule of the event taken place in the zone

Label: Sensor
Comment: A device that detects and responds to events or changes in the physical environment such as light, motion, or temperature changes.nA device that has category saref:Sensor and performs a saref:SensingFunction.

subClass.Label: Sensor
subClass.Comment: A sensor is a device that measures a physical quantity and converts it into a signal which can be read by an observer or by an instrument.

Label: Service
Comment: A service is a representation of a function to a network that makes the function discoverable, registerable, remotely controllable by other devices in the network. A service can represent one or more functions. A Service is offered by a device that wants (a certain set of) its function(s) to be discoverable, registerable, remotely controllable by other devices in the network. A Service must specify the device that is offering the service and the function(s) to be represented.

subClass.Label: Switch on service
subClass.Comment: A type of service that represents an on/off function to the network

Label: Severity
Comment: The quality of being hard to endure, uninviting or formidable.

Label: Slot
Comment: A slot in an ordered list with a fixed index.

Label: Social Unit
Comment: An individual, or a group or community, considered as a discrete constituent of a society or larger group (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Group
subClass.Comment: It represents a collection of two or more people who interact with each other and may have the similar characteristics or objectives.

subClass.Label: Visiting Group
subClass.Comment: A group of two or more people that has the same objective of visiting any space.

subClass.Label: Person
subClass.Comment: It represents a single individual of any age and having any type of characteristics.

subClass.Label: Impaired Person
subClass.Comment: An individual whose natural senses or physical abilities are either diminished or damaged.

subClass.Label: Mental Impaired Person
subClass.Comment: A person having mental impairment in which one's mind is damaged or is not working properly and one have issues such as consciousness, orientation, concentration.

subClass.Label: Physically Impaired Person
subClass.Comment: A physical impairment is a condition in which any part of person's body is either  damaged or is not working properly.

subClass.Label: Sensory Impairmed Person
subClass.Comment: Sensory impairment is when one of the senses such as sight, hearing, smell, touch, taste and spatial awareness, is no longer normal.

Label: Space
Comment: A physical, three dimensional, and one of the most important elements in the design of architecture that can further be divided to create more spaces from it.

subClass.Label: Thoroughfare
subClass.Comment: A road or path forming a route between two places (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Building
subClass.Comment: Buildings are roofed constructions which can be used separately, have been built for permanent purposes, can be entered by persons and are suitable or intended for protecting persons, animals or objects.

subClass.Label: Building Space
subClass.Comment: A Space is a 3D volume bounded by surfaces. It represents the physical spaces of the building.

subClass.Label: Site Of Building
subClass.Comment: Building site is a locale containing one or more separate buildings. They are zones.

subClass.Label: Common Area
subClass.Comment: Amenities such as corridors, hallways, lobby, pool, toilets provided for the comfort and use of all occupants, owners, tenants, or users of a building or building complex.

subClass.Label: Dwelling
subClass.Comment: Place where a person or group of people live.

Label: Stakeholder
Comment: The stakeholder in district or building that has performance goals to be achieved

Label: State
Comment: The state in which a device can be found, e.g, ON/OFF/STANDBY, or ONLINE/OFFLINE. We propose here a list of states that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended.

subClass.Label: Multi level state
subClass.Comment: A type of state

subClass.Label: On off state
subClass.Comment: A type of state

subClass.Label: Open close state
subClass.Comment: A type of state

subClass.Label: Start stop state
subClass.Comment: A type of state

Label: StoringUnit
Comment: Storing unit is the device that stores energy.

Label: Task
Comment: The goal for which a device is designed (from a user perspective). For example, a washing machine is designed for the task of washing. We propose here a list of tasks that are relevant for the purpose of SAREF, but this list can be extended.

subClass.Label: Instant
subClass.Comment: An instant is a time instant

subClass.Label: Interval
subClass.Comment: The time interval of the observation or evaluation

Label: TemporalEntity
Comment: A temporal entity is an instant or an interval

Label: Unit of measure
Comment: The unit of measure is a standard for measurement of a quantity, such as a Property. For example,  Power is a property and Watt is a unit of power that represents a definite predetermined power: when we say 10 Watt, we actually mean 10 times the definite predetermined power called 'watt'. Our definition is based on the definition of unit of measure in the Ontology of units of Measure (OM). We propose here a list of some units of measure that are relevant for the purpose of the Smart Appliances ontology, but this list can be extended.

Label: Unit_of_measure
Comment: The unit of the observation value or KPI calculation value

Label: Weather Forecasting Service
Comment: Represents a service that provides weather forecast to specific locations.
